New Records: The Cubs scored seven runs in an inning for the second time within a week, a feat they last achieved in 2018 (June 28 and July 1)
Key Match Events: The Cubs scored seven runs in the top of the second inning, led by Cody Bellinger's two-run homer
The Nationals stormed back in the bottom of the ninth with a three-run rally, but Keegan Thompson shut the door with a strikeout to deliver the save
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs have scored 80 runs in their past eight games, the most in the Majors during that stretch
They have scored an average of 6.45 runs per game since Aug. 6
Post-Match Reflections: Cody Bellinger said 'it's been really fun' with the team's offensive surge
The win was a team effort all around from the offense and bullpen
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs have won 10 of their last 13 games, sitting five games back from the final NL Wild Card spot
Chicago needed every bit of the seven-run second inning, as the Nats stormed back in the bottom of the ninth with a three-run rally
